intro: Melodinus yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan melodinus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
